attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
AOL today quotes Policy Exchange chief economist Dr Oliver Hartwich,
"Britain needs to consider policies that will make it easier for people to work in places that have high productivity and therefore offer high wages. Urban policy should provide towns and cities with incentives to grow, prevent ghost towns from appearing, and give towns and cities much more freedom to decide how to use regeneration money."

One idea might be to legislate to make independent companies pay for web site "feedback" to encourage people to be more innovative and avoid the exploitation of getting ideas for free. The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to ensure that this voluntary practice, like much of the work in the health and social services, and for medical journals, is paid. It's hardly a rocket science solution to falling standards, is it ?
